segments.pli: 155. Dutiyasaddhammasammosasutta
segments.en: 155. The Decline of the True Teaching (2nd)

segments.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Katame pañca?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū dhammaṃ na pariyāpuṇanti—
segments.en: It’s when the mendicants don’t memorize the teaching—

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the first thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ na vitthārena paresaṃ desenti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t explain the teaching in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the second thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ na vitthārena paraṃ vācenti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t make others recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the third thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ na vitthārena sajjhāyaṃ karonti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fourth thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ na cetasā anuvitakkenti anuvicārenti manasānupekkhanti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants don’t think about and consider the teaching in their hearts, examining it with their minds as they learned and memorized it.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fifth thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Katame pañca?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti—
segments.en: It’s when the mendicants memorize the teaching—

segments.pli: suttaṃ, geyyaṃ, veyyākaraṇaṃ, gāthaṃ, udānaṃ, itivuttakaṃ, jātakaṃ, abbhutadhammaṃ, vedallaṃ.
segments.en: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the first thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ vitthārena paresaṃ desenti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants explain the teaching in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the second thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ vitthārena paraṃ vācenti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants make others recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the third thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ vitthārena sajjhāyaṃ karonti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants recite the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fourth thing …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ cetasā anuvitakkenti anuvicārenti manasānupekkhanti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the mendicants think about and consider the teaching in their hearts, examining it with their minds as they learned and memorized it.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fifth thing that leads to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”

segments.pli: Pañcamaṃ.
